summary: The Export-Import Bank supports U.S. jobs by providing loans, loan guarantees, and insurance to promote U.S. exports. According to its policy, the Bank generally cannot finance defense goods and services unless they are nonlethal and primarily used for civilian rather than military purposes. The Bank monitors these "dual-use" items to ensure they are used mostly for civilian purposes. We report each year on these dual-use...
title: Export-Import Bank: Monitoring of Exports with Dual Military and Civilian Uses as of 2023
